result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
10:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James Edward Bourgeois III appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for James Edward Bourgeois III.  Counsel submits waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court examines the Defendant as to the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver, finding it to be free and voluntary, and binds the Defendant over for trial.  State files information.  Counsel acknowledges receipt of the information, waives reading, and enters not guilty pleas.
Further proceedings scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia

1:00 PM Cases called 22CF220; 22CF230. Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James Edward Bourgeois III appeared by video, in custody. Rachel Boaz appears as a friend of the court stating defendant will qualify. Reading waived.  Defendant's address correct, defendant has no phone.
Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Sheriff dispatch advises defendant is in custody.
Forwarded to Sheriff's
3:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Matthew Vincent Nugent in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James Edward Bourgeois III not in court.  Court forfeits bail and issues warrant.
Sheriff's Office advises bond was posted on 6/17/2022.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia

1:16 PM Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James Edward Bourgeois III appeared by video, in custody.  Atty Heather Dvoran appears stating defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Defendant currently on a probation hold. Court finds probable cause. Court finds good cause to extend time limits. Defendant will hire counsel.
Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
